If you guys ever notice: Whenever the slime splits, they lose half their experience points!
 
The only reason why they stop splitting is because of the exp..!
 
Well, i haven't played gladiators for a couple of months.. but I remember well (due to a buncha experimentations!)
 
Anyways, hope that'll help.
 
(psst, check out my site! http://kamiart.ssxh.net <-- my art site :D)
 
Oh, Gladiators Alpha Beta doesn't work for me :(

Shigeki Miyake-Stoner <shigekims@...> wrote:
I'm just speculating now, but perhaps it has something to do with the
generation degeneration.  For example, "Revenue," who is on your team
splits.  Now there is Revenue, and Revenue Jr.  If Revenue splits again, he
will make another Junior, but if Revenue Jr. Splits, he will make a nameless
blob off himself.  Have you seen how many generations it takes before they
start becoming unnamed? (or rather... SLIME1 etc.)  Only Revenue is 'on your
team' so he is the anomaly that spawns the others, the one, if you will.
From: Daniel Paul Hightower [mailto:alternate_dph@...]
Sent: Sunday, December 14, 2003 8:33 PM
I start with a slime called "Revenue".  After it repeatedly splits,
eventually slimes with no name will show up.  Hypothetically,
all slimes can from "Revenue" so all slimes should have a name, but that
doesn't happen.

My question is when and why that happens.
